Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: M_SHAH000
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very good quality service, staff very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would like to visit it again if I go to madrid. Even though not located in the city centre, there is a very good transportation service. Just 1 minute from the hotel, bus No. 162 takes to Moncloa in about 15/20 minutes. Frequency is also quite good, about 5 buses every hour. Fom Moncloa Metro station there are trains to the city centre of madrid. I was amazed at the metro system of Madrid, very developed and there were no delays or cancellations even on weekends like we have here in London. I found Madrid very interesting and lively place. People are very friendly and helpful. Language is a bit of a problem, its a good idea to learn few spanish words beforehand. I would certainly recommend this place and would like to visit again.

Reviews.Content: Good for family on europe tour and can cook their food themselves. These are aprtment type hotels proivide you a one bed,hall, kitchen with few unencils with refrigerator You can cook your own food and just cozy in the cold days in your room far from city center need your own conveyance or depend on taxi food availability is limited in hotel not room service self service apartment type hotel good for short duration

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: pokoberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night at the very end of my tour of Spain. I was a bit disappointed in this place, as we had previously stayed in much nicer hotels. The decor of the hotel looks like it's stuck in the 60s. The lobby was a dark green color and my room had a pink bathroom - pink sink, pink bathtub, pink toilet. I had a single room and it was average size for European standards. The bed was outdated, and I could feel the springs against my back. The location was pretty good. Just a short taxi ride to Plaza Mayor. If you are on a budget, this is a sufficient hotel, but otherwise, I would stay away.
